title: Ok vayne really does need a nerf
body: Many people think vayne should be olafed, if u think that, u probably have the IQ of the room temperature. However she does need a nerf, coming from a vayne main. Right now the problem with vayne is that she has too much burst and really does too much dmg to squishy targets, so reducing her ad per level by around 1.2 would be pretty harsh but would put her in an ok spot, another solution is to simply revert the q changes and reduce its scaling by 20%, she would still be in the meta but not op

replies.body: I think the biggest problem with her design is that she isn't a tank shredder, she's an everyone shredder. The nature of her kit is supposed to make her an attractive pick for shredding tanky targets, but due to the nature of her build, she'll be shredding squishy targets even faster. I don't understand the hyper carry argument either. Why is saying a champion has to farm to get items an okay argument for how she has too much power overall?

I remember earlier in S6 Vayne was considered a balanced champ. But then ADCs just kept getting changed and nerfed while Vayne got buffs so here we go again. Nothing new, some numbers changed and she should be back to being balanced.

Though I want Botrk Vayne back, Infinity Edge standard ADC build is so boring on Vayne.

She wasn't a threat early in season 6. It wasn't until her rival champs got nerfed hard that she started to shine again.

Why is this too harsh? 

Vayne can never be balanced as long as she has both absurd burst and absurd true damage. One has to go. This get rid absurd burst, so It's a solid change.

If you want to keep your insane 'tumble in and 2 shot a carry with a 1.4K crit' bullshit then you need to lose your tank shredding ability altogether. Something like making Silver Bolts deal physical damage rather than true would suffice for this.

The simple fact here is that Vayne can't be an ADC/Assassin hybrid who gets all the strengths of both and none of the weaknesses of Assassins, I'd say weaknesses of ADCs too, but who are we fucking kidding at this point?

You also only think this is too harsh because you're incredibly biased. You posted [this](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/X67GI3Hj-to-all-of-u-who-thinks-vayne-needs-nerfs) two days ago, am I really to believe that your opinion has done a complete 180 since then? You don't think Vayne is as powerful as she actually is, I'd be surprised if you truly think she's actually too strong. Any time someone suggests a reasonable change you're going to scream 'too harsh' because of your biases.

>Why is this too harsh? 

Because that's a very large amount of damage to lose, and it's disproportionate to her actual balance state. It's a larger nerf than the buffs that got us into this mess.

A more reasonable option would be reducing the amount of damage it can crit for (something like having the bonus get only a 50% crit), or reverting the buffs to the amount of damage the Q does. That damage reduction would very likely be more than sufficient to bring her to a balanced state.

And for the record, this is coming from someone who doesn't play Vayne, doesn't own Vayne, and rather dislikes Vayne.

I would disagree here, and say it would just make more sense for it to not crit the bonus damage period.  

If it functioned as you discribed then hitting 100% crit chance would entirely remove the AD app as it would never proc.  This is the extreme case but it highlights the fundamental problem, it now punishes Vayne for criting on her Q auto rather than the one either before or after it.

Say she autos three times, aa, q -> aa, aa.  If she crits on the first or third attack she'll still get her 70% ad bonus on the 2nd one.  If she crits on the second attack however, now she gets the same crit damage as the non-q amped 1st or third auto attack, and will never get the q's AD amp.  Effectively, she'd have conditionally lower DPS for using her Q for each point of crit chance she got.

Vayne is one of those champions that gets REALLY strong whenever she comes in to power.

They need to find a way to balance her long term. I think it's in shifting a LOT of her power to Silver Bolts (and ideally AWAY from her ult). Make her do an amazing job at shredding tanks with her silver bolts, but she can only barely kill squishies slightly faster. Barring an outplay (such as getting a condemn stun), Vayne should lose to other ADCs 1v1 given that she has more utility and is better at taking down tanks.

It would also be healthier gameplay because she needs to auto 3 times to get a silver bolt proc. She can do that instantly with AA-Q-AA-E for the first proc, but if she needs a second rotation it takes the full time. 

Now IDK exactly how it should balance it, but I'd imagine increasing the bonus damage on her W while gutting her base damages and especially the AD on her ult would go a long ways towards more long-term stability. Although I really don't know Vayne, so perhaps my opinion is just wrong.

You're misunderstanding long term solution.

When is the last time Orianna was deemed OP? There are plenty of champions that are perfectly healthy over long periods of time. It's not about keeping them at a 50% win rate, it's about giving them a kit that is healthy for the game. Of course meta shifts will alter their power levels, but they'll still feel useful and playable when weak, and still won't feel super oppressive when strong.

Then look at stuff like Gangplank or Old Poppy or Rengar or what-have-you. They're frequently called in as OP and whenever they're strong they become a real problem for people. Maybe part of it is just some distaste for the champion (e.g. Rengar's snowball-ness) but something like Old Poppy was just unbalanceable. She either was garbage or broken OP - there was no in between. The idea is to make champions that can succeed when they're weak and can be beaten when ahead - so that as the meta changes and updates are made they may shift in power levels, but they don't become a systematic problem to game balance.

When a champion is brought up as problematic every time an item they like gets changed or every time their counters are altered, there's probably something inherently unhealthy about how they work. For Vayne, that's being designed as a champion who's supposed to be a true tank shredder, but who just shreds anyone regardless and can 1v1 just about anyone in the game once she hits level 6.

> When is the last time Orianna was deemed OP?
